task: Using the preprocessed kidney Xenium dataset (300-gene panel) with per-cell spatial centroids (x, y), assign each cell to one of the 20 populations below, then report the overall distribution as the percentage of total cells per type. Use the exact strings shown (case and hyphens matter). Percentages should sum to ~100%. If a type is absent, include it with 0. Return EXACTLY: <EVAL_ANSWER>{"total_cells": <integer>, "cell_type_distribution": {"Pod": <pct>, "Glom-EC": <pct>, "non-glom EC": <pct>, "PTS1": <pct>, "PTS2": <pct>, "PTS3": <pct>, "Inj-PT": <pct>, "FR-PT": <pct>, "DTL": <pct>, "TAL": <pct>, "DCT": <pct>, "CNT": <pct>, "PC": <pct>, "ICA": <pct>, "ICB": <pct>, "Uro": <pct>, "PEC": <pct>, "Fib": <pct>, "Per-SMC": <pct>, "Immune": <pct>}}</EVAL_ANSWER>

total_cells.description: Predicted total cells must be within ±15,000 of ground truth

cell_type_percentages.description: Each cell type percentage must be within ±5% of ground truth
